titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the North Hempstead, Oyster Bay, and South Hempstead agreement 1977.474
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:10:10 +0000.

did.unittitle: North Hempstead, Oyster Bay, and South Hempstead agreement
did.abstract: One handwritten copy of an agreement establishing the creation of a public yard for the purpose of pasturing sheep in the towns of North Hempstead, Oyster Bay, and South Hempstead in Long Island, N.Y., dated August 22, 1791. A list of signers of the document is also included.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); North Hempstead, Oyster Bay, and South Hempstead agreement, 1977.474, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
